card.name: .30 / '06 Bolt-Action Rifle
card.text: Add 3 points to Ally's value. One Weapon per Ally. If Ally is Discarded or Buried, this Weapon suffers the same fate.

card.name: .32 Revolver
card.text: Add 2 points to Ally's value. One Weapon per Ally. If Ally is Discarded or Buried, this revolver suffers the same fate.

card.name: Agoraphobia
card.text: At the beginning of your Turn, lose 1 Sanity point if the top card of your Story Deck features the Outside attribute.

card.name: Alone in the World
card.text: Some people are paranoid to PHOBIA levels. They carry a WEAPON and are always afraid of an AMBUSH. Skulking about in CEMETERY LOCATIONS (TWO DIFFERENT CARDS) they often become CORRUPT CULTISTs and summon blasphemous horrors, such as the SERVITOR OF THE OUTER GODS, in THE FORGOTTEN CRYPT.

card.name: Ambush
card.text: During the next Combat, if your Current Location is in the same sub-region as opponent's Current Location, and both Locations have the City attribute, your Allies may attack your opponent as if they were in the same Location.

card.name: Arkham Horror
card.text: BUSINESS is terrible - the rain has turned into a DOWNPOUR. SAMUEL WINSOR and his FAITHFUL HOUNDS are forced to flee from TWO MONSTERS which erupt from the river near the MISKATONIC UNIVERSITY COMMONS. TWO STEADFAST ALLIES in a nearby HOUSE have a WEAPON and offer to help. The monsters destroy the ARKHAM GAZETTE building, but the group makes a stand at the STATION and defeats them.

card.name: Arkham Police Department
card.text: If this is your Current Location during Combat, reduce each Directed Threat attacking you by 1 point when Threats are revealed.

card.name: Bellevue Hospital
card.text: Gain 5 Sanity points now, but you must spend next Turn in hydrotherapy (play no cards, do not Pass). During each additional Turn that you remain here you may Bury one Phobia affecting your Investigator.

card.name: Blasphemous Obeisance
card.text: May only be cast during Combat. Return a random card in target Directed Threat to that player's Hand.

card.name: Bored Clerk
card.text: During the Discard phase, you must keep at least this minimum number of cards in your hand. You may keep up to this Maximum. If you have fewer than your Minimum, you may not Discard any; if you have more than your Maximum, you must Discard some

card.text: May only be cast during Combat. Rotate Defending Ally to indicated it is the target. If the target Defending Ally would be Buried, he or she is Discarded instead.

card.name: Congregational Hospital
card.text: Your electro-shock therapy is a success. Set aside this card and shuffle your Story Deck. Randomly Discard one Story Deck card, then replace this card. During each additional Turn that you remain here you may Bury one Phobia affecting your Investigator.

card.name: Cthulhu Rising
card.text: Your opponent must Discard his or her Current Location if it features the Water attribute, otherwise Bury it. Then, Bury this card.

card.name: Dark Young
card.text: These creatures are Invisible if your opponent is in a Forested Location. Joins Dark Young.

card.name: Dawn of the Solstice
card.text: This is a Solstice card. It is now Day. Bury any Day or Night event in play.

card.name: Deep One
card.text: Add 2 points to the value of this card if any Storm Event is in play. Joins Deep Ones.

card.name: Downpour
card.text: While this card is in play you must walk to all City Locations. Travel Events may be played normally. Bury this card if any Day or Night Event is played.

card.name: Dr. Allen
card.text: Can know any one Spell. Bury Spell in your Story Deck after it is cast. Joins Gomes.

card.name: Dr. Hammond's Nerve & Brain Tablets
card.text: Give this card to one of your Allies in play. That Ally and one other of your choice are excluded (as if they weren't present) when determining the results of an Epidemic. If Ally is Buried or Discarded, then this Artifact suffers the same fate.

card.name: Dust of Suleiman
card.text: Summon or Control a Lesser Independent Monster.

card.name: Essex Institute
card.text: Trepanning is fun! Randomly Discard one card from your Hand. During each additional Turn that you remain here you may Bury one Phobia affecting your Investigator.

card.name: Evening
card.text: It is now Night. Bury any Day or Night cards in play. When this card is played, the player may Discard one card from his or her hand and replace it with the top card of his or her Mythos Deck.

card.name: Governmental Cover-up
card.text: It never happened! When played on your opponent, you may force him or her to Discard the Event closest to the bottom of his or her Story Deck.

card.name: Granny Orne
card.text: Remain with Granny Orne for an additional Turn in any Kingsport Location and cause one Phobia affecting your Investigator to be Buried.

card.name: Harry Houdini
card.text: A noted escape artist, Bury Harry Houdini only if he takes his full card value in Sanity loss during Combat.

card.text: During each additional Turn that you remain here you may Bury one Phobia affecting your Investigator.

card.name: Laban Shrewsbury
card.text: While this card is in play, you may later assign to Laban Shewsbury one Tome card at any Location. This Tome remains with Laban and suffers any fate that Laban suffers. The Tome may contain Spells. The Tome may be replaced with another, if lost.

card.name: Lightning Gun
card.text: Add 1 point to Ally's value. One Weapon per Ally. If Ally is Discarded or Buried, this weapon suffers the same fate. If this weapon causes Sanity loss to your opponent's Allies or Investigator, it also destroys (Buries) a random Artifact of opponent.

card.name: Lonely Akeley Farmhouse
card.text: You may use this Gate more than once whenever you have the Speech Machine in play, but must pay this card's Sanity cost for each subsequent Gate use.

card.name: Luther Harden
card.text: Protection from Police Investigation and from cards that cause you to lose Artifacts or Tomes. At the moment when you would lose an Artifact or a Tome, you may choose to Bury this card instead. Your opponent must then Bury his or her card.

card.name: Martin's Beach Monster, The
card.text: Able to paralyze victims. When Directed Threat is revealed, randomly choose two of your opponent's Allies (Defending or not) and Flip cards face-down.

card.name: Mi-Go
card.text: Each Mi-Go surviving to affect your opponent's Allies or Investigator also steals one chosen Artifact. Your opponent must Bury the card in his or her Story Deck. Joins Mi-Go.

card.name: Mi-Go
card.text: Joins Mi-Go.

card.name: Midnight
card.text: It is now Night. Bury any Day or Night Event in play. At the moment that this card is played, all Steadfast Allies with Weapons are Flipped face-down.

card.name: Miskatonic University Commons
card.text: All of your Professors and Students add 1 point to their card value while this card is your Current Location.

card.name: Miss Anna Tilton
card.text: While this card is in play, on a later turn you may assign to Miss Anna Tilton, curator of the Historical Society, one Artifact card at any Location. This Artifact remains with Anna and suffers any fate that Anna suffers. This Artifact may be replaced with another, if lost.

card.name: Mrs. Sonia Lovecraft
card.text: Add 2 points to the value of this card while you have Howard Lovecraft in play. Also, Mrs. Sonia Lovecraft is not turned Corrupt by cards that turn Allies Corrupt. Joins Howard Lovecraft.

card.name: Mystery at Martin's Beach, The
card.text: There is a big party for a STEADFAST ALLY at MARTIN'S BEACH, but it ends in horror when THE MARTIN'S BEACH MONSTER rises from the bowels of the sea. All those present develop a terrible PHOBIA. They must now regularly take DR. HAMMOND'S NERVE & BRAIN TABLETS to stop their nightmares of CTHULHU RISING

card.name: N'gah-Kthun
card.text: You may play this card as an Ally at any Country/Gate Location (uses Gate). While this card is in play as an Ally, you may play other Mi-Go as Allies at Country/Gate Locations (uses Gate). This Special Effects box is valid even when N'gah-Kthun is in play as an Ally. Joins Mi-Go.

card.name: N'kai
card.text: You may play this card only if your Current Location is Underground. You must walk out of N'kai. While at N'kai, all Monsters in your Threat function as if it is Night.

card.name: Namquit Point
card.text: A secret place to unload ships. While this is your Current Location, as your Turn you may spend 2 Sanity points to recover one Artifact chosen from your Story Deck and place it on the table beside your Investigator. Pay any Sanity costs for playing that Artifact.

card.name: Newburyport Historical Society
card.text: While this is your Current Location all Steadfast Allies add 1 point to their card value.

card.name: Newburyport Public Library
card.text: While this is your Current Location all Steadfast Allies add 1 point to their card value.

card.name: Old Congregational Church
card.text: For each additional Turn you remain here, you may Bury one Phobia affecting your Investigator.

card.name: Penn Central Train Station
card.text: You may play this card immediately after playing a Train Travel by Land Event, on the same Turn.

card.name: Petrify
card.text: Target becomes an Artifact: place Ally and any attached cards face-down on the Artifacts side of opponent's Investigator. Affected Ally may not be Flipped face-up while he or she is an Artifact. At the end of the Round return Ally face-up to his or her proper position.

card.name: Portaphobia
card.text: At the beginning of your Turn, lose 1 Sanity point if your Current Location features the Gate attribute.

card.name: Price, The
card.text: By summoning a SERVITOR MONSTER, a CORRUPT CULTIST captures a STEADFAST ALLY from a KINGSPORT LOCATION. Taking him to dark N'KAI, the Cultist uses an ENCHANTED KNIFE for his unspeakable ceremony. From the smoke of burning incense, ancient TULZSCHA is brought forth.

card.name: Questionable Judgement
card.text: It all began in a boring LIBRARY. All those books waiting to be sorted. There must be a better way ... But wait ... That musty TOME. Wow, is it old! It reveals TWO GATE LOCATIONS (in DIFFERENT CITIES) where one can summon a MONSTER. The tome also contains a blasphemous SPELL, completing the training of a new CORRUPT CULTIST.

card.name: Ray Stuckey
card.text: Protection from Police Investigation and from cards that cause you to lose Artifacts or Tomes. At the moment that you would lose an Artifact or Tome, you may choose to Bury this card instead. You opponent must then Bury his or her card.

card.name: Rebellious Youth
card.text: During the Discard phase, you must keep at least this minimum number of cards in your hand. You may keep up to this Maximum. If you have fewer than your Minimum, you may not Discard any; if you have more than your Maximum, you must Discard some

card.name: Samuel Winsor
card.text: As your turn, Flip this card and your Current Location gains the Church attribute as long as Samuel Winsor remains Flipped and that Location remains your top Story Deck card. During each additional Turn that you remain in this Location and that Winsor remains Flipped you may Bury one Phobia affecting your Investigator.

card.name: Searching for Laban Shrewsbury
card.text: A LETTER FROM A FRIEND reveals that noted explorer LABAN SHREWSBURY is missing. The ARKHAM POLICE DEPARTMENT has been notified, but the Detective LUTHER HARDEN has no luck in his search. He thinks Dr. Shrewsbury may have been captured by a HUNTING HORROR. After Harden gets his WEAPON, the search lasts into the EVENING before Dr. Shrewsbury is found trapped in the OLD CONGREGATIONAL CHURCH.

card.name: Servant of Glaaki
card.text: Add 1 point to the value of this card if either Revelations Of Glaaki or a Night card is in play. Joins Servants of Glaaki.

card.name: Servitor of the Outer Gods
card.text: Add 2 points to the value of this card if a Great Old One or an Outer God is in play when this card is revealed. While a Servitor of the Outer Gods is in a Threat all other Monsters in the same Threat are classified as Lesser Servitors.

card.name: Soulful Jazz Singer
card.text: During the Discard phase, you must keep at least this minimum number of cards in your hand. You may keep up to this Maximum. If you have fewer than your Minimum, you may not Discard any; if you have more than your Maximum, you must Discard some

card.name: Speech Machine
card.text: This Artifact has constant effect. While this card is in play, increase the value of all your Mi-Go and Mi-Go Leaders by 1 point each.

card.name: Squire Sawyer Whateley
card.text: While this card is in play, add one to the Maximum number of cards that you may keep in your hand. Cumulative with other Allies that raise your Maximum.

card.name: Succumb to Temptation
card.text: A random Steadfast Ally of the chosen opponent goes mad. That Ally immediately attacks his or her Investigator (unaffected Allies of that opponent may Defend). Then, Bury this card and return the affected Ally to that Investigator's side.

card.name: Terrible Old Man, The
card.text: Can know any one Spell. Bury Spell in your Story Deck after it is cast. Protection from cards that would cause you to lose Artifacts. At the moment that you would lose an Artifact, you may choose to Bury this card instead. Your opponent must then Bury his or her card.

card.name: Tiara of Opulent Fantasy
card.text: Costs 1 point of Sanity to use. Replace all of the attributes (not Title or Special Effects) of your Current Location with all of the attributes on your target's Current Location. If you use a Gate, rotate your own Location card. Flip this card when used.

card.name: Train
card.text: On a following Turn, play a new Location in the same Region, right-side-up on top of your Story Deck. You may remain on the Train for a Turn to play an Ally card that could be played in this Region (only one Ally per Train card played).

card.name: Train
card.text: On a following Turn, play a new Location in the same Region, right-side-up on top of your Story Deck. You may remain on the Train for a Turn to play an Ally card that could be played in this Region (only one Ally per Train card played).

card.name: Tulzscha
card.text: It is Day. Bury any Night or Day cards in play; new ones may not be played while Tulzscha is in play. While this card is in play, three Passes are required to end card play in a Round. No Investigator may gain Sanity.

card.name: Two Cities and a Tale
card.text: The journey began in a KINGSPORT LOCATION. From there, the TRAIN allowed passage to a NEW YORK LOCATION where MRS. SONIA LOVECRAFT introduced you to the famous AUTHOR. The evening was spent listening to his fascinating MONSTER stories. How could he make it all up?

card.name: Two Scepters, The
card.text: As long as the wielder is chosen as a Defending Ally, he raises the card value of all other Corrupt Defending Allies by 1 point per card. Not cumulative with another Ally's Command Ability.

card.name: Waterbury State Hospital
card.text: Gain 4 Sanity points, but reveal the top card of your Mythos Deck. Apply any Sanity gain or loss indicated in the pentagram on the card, then Discard it. During each additional Turn that you remain here you may Bury one Phobia affecting your Investigator.

card.name: Whispers in Darkness
card.text: The letter came from HENRY W. AKELEY. His tales were corroborated by the strange TOME and SPEECH MACHINE in his package. Traveling by CAR to the LONELY AKELEY FARMHOUSE revealed strange buzzing sounds from the building. Inside, Henry was conversing with N'GAH-KTHUN, planning a GOVERNMENTAL COVER-UP.

card.name: Yithian
card.text: Can switch bodies with opponent's Ally. When revealed, you may Bury this card and replace it in your Threat with opponent's random Defending Ally for the remainder of Combat. Bury Ally in original player's Story Deck at the end of Combat.
